5 Fantastic Zoos in Kerala for Wildlife Enthusiasts Explore Countries Singapore Thailand Sri lanka Vietnam India Bali Dubai Maldives Bhutan Kenya Europe Packages Top Travel Agents Collections Join as travel agent Log in/Sign up × Log in/Sign up Countries Singapore Thailand Sri lanka Vietnam India Bali Dubai Maldives Bhutan Kenya Europe Packages Top Travel Agents Collections Join as a travel agent About Us Reach out to us on: [email protected] © Holidify Travels Pvt Ltd.- All Right Reserved Kerala Packages Places To Visit Photos Best Time To Visit Map View Zoos in Kerala for Wildlife Enthusiasts Home Collections Kerala Collections Zoos in Kerala for Wildlife... ₹ 7,499 onwards View Packages Get Package Offers Zoos in Kerala Kerala, known for its lush greenery and rich biodiversity, is home to several zoos that offer a glimpse into the state's diverse wildlife. From the majestic elephants to exotic bird species and elusi (Read More)ve big cats, Kerala's zoos showcase a wide array of fauna amidst naturalistic settings. These zoos serve as vital centers for wildlife conservation and education, providing visitors with opportunities to learn about the importance of preserving endangered species and their habitats. Whether it's exploring the tropical forests of Thrissur Zoo or marveling at the colorful inhabitants of Thiruvananthapuram Zoo, Kerala's zoos offer immersive experiences for nature lovers and wildlife enthusiasts alike. Here is the list of 5 Zoos in Kerala for Wildlife Enthusiasts 1. Thrissur Zoo, Thrissur 4.1 /5 Thrissur Zoo, also known as the State Museum and Zoo, is located in Thrissur, Kerala, and is one of the oldest zoos in India. Spread over 13.5 acres, it houses a diverse collection of indigenous and exotic animals, including lions, tigers, elephants, and various bird and reptile species. The zoo is renowned for its conservation efforts, breeding programs, and educational initiatives aimed at promoting wildlife conservation and environmental sustainability. Read More 2. Zoological Park, Trivandrum 4.3 /5 The Zoological Park in Trivandrum, also known as the Thiruvananthapuram Zoo, is a renowned destination showcasing a diverse range of wildlife species, including lions, tigers, elephants, and exotic birds. With its extensive collection of animals and commitment to conservation efforts, the zoo attracts visitors of all ages, offering educational exhibits and guided tours to promote awareness about wildlife conservation and environmental protection. Read More 3. Parassinikkadavu Snake Park, Kannur 4.0 /5 Regarded as one of the finest snake sanctuaries of Asia, the Parassinikadavu Snake Park is the pride of the south. It is one of the most prominent reptile preservation centres in the country and is the only one in Kerala. The Parassinikadavu Snake Park is home to over 150 different species of reptiles like crocodiles, monitor lizards and snakes- both venomous and non-venomous. With its educational exhibits, diverse collection of reptiles, and efforts in wildlife conservation, Parassinikkadavu Snake Park provides an engaging and informative experience for visitors of all ages. Read More 4. Kauthuka Park, Thrissur 4.5 /5 Nestled along the route to the majestic Athirappally Waterfalls in Thrissur district, Kauthuka Park stands as a testament to the marvels of nature and human ingenuity. Founded by Mr. Varkey Veliyath, a humble farmer, this enchanting park spans 1.25 acres and offers a collection of rare and exotic plants, including medicinal herbs and aromatic spices, offering visitors a chance to explore Kerala's rich botanical heritage. Abhayaranyam Zoo, Ernakulam Often known for Elephants in the state, the Abhayaranyam mini zoo is located at Kaprikkad village in Ernakulam district. The zoo is part of an ecotourism project which aims at rehabilitation of Elephants from the Kodanad Elephant Training center due to lack of space for accommodating the increased number of animals. Apart from elephants, there are other animals as well, which are housed in the zoo, which is going to be maintained like a wildlife safari, ensuring that the animals are left to their natural habitat.
